thread.title: Late dunk by Kelly gives Lakers 104-102 win over Trail Blazers
thread.title_full: Late dunk by Kelly gives Lakers 104-102 win over Trail Blazers

author: The Associated Press
title: Late dunk by Kelly gives Lakers 104-102 win over Trail Blazers
text: Late dunk by Kelly gives Lakers 104-102 win over Trail Blazers The Associated Press Print this article Advertisement LOS ANGELES — Ryan Kelley drove the lane for a tiebreaking dunk off an inbounds play with 2 seconds remaining, leading the Los Angeles Lakers to a 104-102 preseason victory over the Portland Trail Blazers on Monday night. Lakers point guard D’Angelo Russell, the second overall pick in the draft, hit three jumpers during a 2-minute span — the last one with 1:28 remaining to give the Lakers a 98-89 cushion. Portland responded with a 13-4 run, tying the score on a 3-pointer by Pat Connaughton with 4.8 seconds to go. Kelly took Jabari Brown’s inbounds pass from the left sideline and soared over Noah Vonleh for the winning points. Portland’s last gasp was a missed 20-footer at the buzzer by Vonleh off an inbounds pass from Omari Johnson. “It’s disappointing to lose it that way, when we had come back and made some great plays that put ourselves in a position to win,” Blazers coach Terry Stotts said. “I feel better about that, than if we had lost by 10. But I look at the game more in total than just the ending, since it’s a preseason game.” Jordan Clarkson led the Lakers with 17 points and Damian Lillard 20 for Portland. More like this story
